Section.Catchline: Department of Legal Affairs; powers and duties.

SectionBody.Text: It shall be the duty of the department to assist persons who are victims of crime.

Paragraph.Text: Establish and maintain an office in Tallahassee and prescribe the duties of the employees of the Crime Victims’ Services Office.
Adopt rules pursuant to ss. 120.536(1) and 120.54 to implement the provisions of this chapter.
Prepare an annual written report of the activities of the Crime Victims’ Services Office, which shall be available on the department’s Internet website.
Authorize other units within the department to assist in carrying out the provisions of this chapter.

Subsection.Text: The department shall provide the Crime Victims’ Services Office with legal representation relative to its duties and responsibilities under this chapter.

The department shall have a criminal history record check performed through the Florida Crime Information Center system on any victim or other claimant on whose behalf an award is sought under ss. 960.01-960.28.
The department shall establish criteria governing awards for catastrophic injury as a direct result of a crime.
